Header.title: The MOOClet Framework
Header.paragraph: Unifying Experimentation, Dynamic Improvement & Personalization in Online Courses

About.paragraph: A MOOClet is a digital component – like an explanation in an online course or problem – designed using the MOOClet technology. This technology enables instructors and researchers to engage in a wide range of A/B experimentation, crowdsourcing, real-time data analysis, and personalization.
Why: Enabling Experimentation, Data-Driven Improvement, and Personalization of Motivational Messages
Why2: Learnersourcing Versions for Iterative Adaptive Experimentation

Features.title: Implementation of Online Field Experiments
Features.text: One use of the MOOClet Framework is to turn a static educational resource (webpage, explanation, problem, email, discussion forum) into an adaptive resource that can be continually improved and personalized as more students use it and new ideas emerge

Features.title: Accelerating Improvement of Educational Resources using Data from Experiments
Features.text: This can also open up new opportunities for research on how to improve methods for adaptive experimentation in real-world contexts.

Features.title: Data-Driven Personalization
Features.text: The famework’s approach to personalization is also flexible because at any point in time, these characterstics, interactions, and algorithms can be easily modified. Therefore, MOOClets can make it easier to apply existing approaches to new settings and then refine them over time.

Features.title: Relationship to Common Specifications, Standards & Infrastructures in Education
Features.text: The key value addition of the MOOClet is that such data could be easily used by multiple different algorithms or methods for experimentation, dynamic improvement, and personalization.
